title: Senegal: Ruling party's presidential candidate concedes to anti-establishment Faye
summary: Former prime minister Amadou Ba conceded defeat to Bassirou Diomaye Faye, the right-hand man of outgoing president Macky Sall's main opponent, Ousmane Sonko.

title: Gaza: UN Security Council demands 'immediate' ceasefire for first time, US abstains
summary: The resolution calls for a ceasefire during Ramadan and for the release of all hostages taken captive during Hamas' October 7 attack in Israel.

title: Moscow attack: Putin brought back to reality
summary: The murderous attack perpetrated on March 22 in the suburbs of the Russian capital swept away the image of omnipotence staged by the Russian president.

title: Romania's race to develop its transportation network with Ukraine
summary: Bucharest has launched various infrastructure projects aimed at increasing dealings with its northern neighbor. This includes a highway that could facilitate arms deliveries to Kyiv.

title: Trump says he will be able to pay his reduced bond of $175 million within 10 days
summary: A New York appeals court significantly lowered the bond imposed on the Republican presidential candidate after his conviction for exaggerating the value of his business assets.

title: Jasmin Paris becomes first woman to conquer the legendary Barkley ultra-endurance race
summary: On Friday, March 22, the 40-year-old British runner finished the Barkley Marathon, a grueling 160-kilometer race with a 60-hour time limit. Since its inception in 1986, only 20 individuals have finished the race, with five achieving this feat in the 2024 edition.

title: Venezuela's new opposition candidate: An unknown 80-year-old academic
summary: After Maria Corina Machado, the opposition union candidate, was barred from contesting the July election against President Maduro by courts, she announced being 'represented' by an unknown figure, Corina Yoris.

title: Putin blames 'Islamists' for Moscow attack but links them to Ukraine
summary: In a televised public statement, recently re-elected Russian President Vladimir Putin for the first time acknowledged that 'radical Islamists' had carried out the attack, all while fanning the flames of their ties to Ukraine.

title: Ukrainian police evacuate villages bordering Russia
summary: The Russian army, in response to incursions into its territory by Ukraine-aligned commandos, has relentlessly bombarded the border region near the Ukrainian city of Sumy.

title: Florida passes law banning social media use for children 13 and under
summary: Under a bill signed by Republican Governor Ron DeSantis on Monday, Florida will implement one of the nation's strictest social media restrictions for minors.

title: UK and US blame China for 'malicious' cyber attacks
summary: The allied countries announced sanctions and charges on figures linked to APT31, a group linked to a 'prolific global hacking operation' in the US and UK, and campaigns targeting the UK Electoral Commission and lawmakers.

title: As Macron visits French Guiana, local officials call for autonomy
summary: The French president is visiting the overseas territory on the South American continent. Local elected officials expect a constitutional revision to give their local government more autonomy, as has been promised to Corsica.

title: European elections: Disunited 'Frexit' candidates mull improbable but vital alliance
summary: Nicolas Dupont-Aignan, François Asselineau and Florian Philippot all want to join the European Parliament, even though they relentlessly denounce it online. But if they run disunited, they stand little chance of passing the 5% threshold for earning seats.

title: Trump's hush money trial date set for April 15
summary: Donald Trump's Manhattan trial on charges of paying pre-election hush money to the porn star Stormy Daniels had been delayed as the defense asked for time to examine a last-minute document dump.

title: Paleontologist Delphine Angst: 'The dodo was neither stupid, obese nor maladjusted'
summary: On the occasion of the reconstitution of a pair of these birds, exhibited at the Paris Museum National d'Histoire Naturelle, the scientist explains the difficulties involved in studying them.

title: Tuberculosis: Millions of undiagnosed cases jeopardize control efforts
summary: The WHO estimates that in 2022, 3 million new cases went undetected by health services. People with few or no symptoms could account for a significant proportion of these, and diagnosis is particularly difficult in children.

title: France and Germany to co-produce military equipment in Ukraine
summary: The KNDS conglomerate, which brings together Germany's KMW and France's Nexter Systems, will produce spare parts, ammunition and, eventually, complete weapons systems.

title: Boeing announces CEO Dave Calhoun will step down
summary: The sweeping personnel changes come in the wake of Boeing's near-catastrophic incident in January when a fuselage panel on an Alaska Airlines jet blew off mid-flight.

title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' homes raided over sexual trafficking and assault claims
summary: Two properties belonging to the music mogul in Los Angeles and Miami were searched Monday by federal agents as part of an ongoing sex trafficking investigation by federal authorities in New York.

title: Paul Andreu's aerial metaphysics exhibited at Paris' Cité de l'Architecture
summary: The architect of Roissy airport and other major installations is the subject of a varied and splendid exhibition in Paris.

title: Togo adopts a new constitution
summary: The new text transitions the small West African nation from a presidential to a parliamentary system, wherein the president will be elected by legislators rather than directly by the public.

title: Macron visits Brazil, showcasing much-improved relations with Lula
summary: Relations between France and Brazil have grown warmer since Lula defeated Jair Bolsonaro, despite some sticking points on international conflicts or agriculture.

title: Considering the world through the animal gaze
summary: Adopting an animal's perspective encourages us to shift our perspective and reevaluate the dynamics of human societies.

title: Baltimore's Francis Scott Key Bridge collapses after ship collision
summary: Search and rescue efforts are under way after vehicles on the bridge were sent into the water early Tuesday morning.

title: Venezuela's Maduro files election candidacy, opposition coalition blocked
summary: The opposition coalition said its bid to register 80-year-old university professor Corina Yoris proved unsuccessful.

title: Moscow attack: Flaws at the top, a scapegoat abroad
summary: After overlooking warnings of a terrorist threat, Russian authorities are resolute in accusing Ukraine of involvement in the attack on Moscow's Crocus City Hall, in which  144 people were killed. The suspects admitted their guilt after being tortured.

title: Macron's flexed bicep, a tribute to sports or a manly comeback to Putin?
summary: The black-and-white shot of France's head of state in the middle of a boxing sparring session, a display of outdated masculinity, has social media buzzing.

title: Who is Bassirou Diomaye Faye, Senegal's new president?
summary: Still unknown to the general public a year ago, the candidate of Senegal's main opposition party won in the first round on Sunday, March 24. It was a historic victory.

title: Russia extends arrest of US journalist Evan Gershkovich to June 30
summary: Gershkovich, a reporter at the Wall Street Journal, has already spent almost a year behind bars.

title: Kenya to release first cult massacre bodies to families
summary: 429 bodies exhumed between April and October last year are due to be released to families for burial after a self-professed pastor allegedly encouraged his followers to starve to death.

title: US allows adoption of Gaza ceasefire resolution, without asserting a change in course
summary: The American abstention from the vote triggered an open crisis between Israel and Washington. While the White House is at pains to play down the significance of its gesture, it nonetheless reflects its exasperation with Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: France's deficit stood at 5.5% of GDP in 2023, well above forecasts
summary: As a result of slower growth and lower tax revenues, the figure was 0.6 points higher than the French government had predicted.

title: UK judges delay Assange extradition ruling
summary: Two UK judges on Tuesday gave the United States three weeks to provide 'assurances' over concerns the Wikileaks founder will be prejudiced at trial because he is not an American citizen and that he could face the death penalty if convicted.

title: Russian court remands eighth Moscow attack suspect in custody
summary: Moscow earlier announced it had detained 11 people in connection with the attack on a Moscow concert hall that killed at least 139 people. The latest suspect is a man originally from the Central Asian country of Kyrgyzstan.

title: Migrant transfers from Paris ahead of Olympics anger mayors
summary: Elected officials believe the transfers are linked to clean-up efforts ahead of the Paris Olympics.
